thread.title: Services sector grows in positive sign for economy
thread.title_full: Services sector grows in positive sign for economy

author: iswanson@thehill.com (Vicki Needham)
title: Services sector grows in positive sign for economy
text:
Services sector grows in positive sign for economy Getty Images By Vicki Needham - 07/06/15 01:32 PM EDT 
Growth in the service sector picked up in June, a sign the economy is regaining strength after slumping earlier this year. 
The Institute for Supply Management on Monday said its index rose slightly to 56 last month from 55.7 in May. ADVERTISEMENT Any readings above 50 signal expansion. 
The index is a survey of a wide variety of businesses. The services sector employs 90 percent of all workers, including those at restaurants, hotels and retailers. 
An increase in business activity and new orders helped boost performance despite a slow down in hiring. 
Business activity increased to 61.5 from 59.5 while new orders rose to 58.3 from 57.9 in May. 
Meanwhile, employers pulled back on hiring with the index falling to 52.7 last month from 55.3 in May. 
Whether that is a sign that the sector will see a broader slow down in hiring remains to be seen. 
On Thursday, the government reported that employers had added 223,000 jobs in June, while the unemployment rate fell to 5.3 percent. 
The economy has added 12.8 million private-sector jobs over a record-high 64 straight months. 
The economy contracted at a 0.2 percentage point annual rate in the first three months of the year, but economists are expecting an acceleration of upward of 3 percentage points in the April-June period. Tags:
